response.overview: A continuously running installation of two video monitors on pedestals, overlooked by a green Kit-Cat clock. A small and large monitor display two different video collages of footage from the Emerald Square Mall and its 1989 construction with interferences of Channel J's Emerald City TV (1976-1979): the self-proclaimed "world’s first television show for gay men and women", Huge Video's Heat in the Night (1989), Genet's Un Chant D'Amour (1950), a Lucky Strikes Square Dance commercial (1948), and a performance of a mylar-clad figure wrapping up the television in videotape.
response.title: Emerald ▣
